title: Here is a list of 20 influential articles on machine reasoning up to 2020. These articles cover various aspects of the field, including logical reasoning, probabilistic reasoning, and neural-symbolic integration
**"A Theory of Probabilistic Reasoning"**
This foundational work introduces Bayesian networks and their application to probabilistic reasoning
**"Inductive Logic Programming: Theory and Methods"** - Stephen Muggleton and Luc De Raedt
A comprehensive overview of inductive logic programming (ILP), a key area in machine reasoning

author.literal: **"Markov Logic Networks"** - Matthew Richardson and Pedro Domingos

title: This paper presents Markov Logic Networks (MLNs), which combine first-order logic and probabilistic graphical models
**"Probabilistic Reasoning in Intelligent Systems: Networks of Plausible Inference"**
Another seminal work by Pearl, focusing on probabilistic reasoning and Bayesian networks
**"Learning Probabilistic Relational Models"**
This paper discusses probabilistic relational models (PRMs), which extend Bayesian networks to relational data
**"A Survey of Reinforcement Learning: Problems, Methods, and Applications"**
A survey that covers reinforcement learning, which is closely related to decision-making and reasoning under uncertainty
**"Neural-Symbolic Learning Systems: Foundations and Applications"**
This book discusses the integration of neural networks and symbolic reasoning
**"The Knowledge Graph Completion Challenge: A Review of Approaches"**
A review of methods for completing knowledge graphs, which are essential for reasoning over structured data
**"DeepPath: A Reinforcement Learning Method for Knowledge Graph Reasoning"**
publisher: Wenhan Xiong, Thien Hoang, and William Yang Wang

title: This paper introduces DeepPath, a reinforcement learning approach for reasoning over knowledge graphs
**"Differentiable Inductive Logic Programming"** - Richard Evans and Edward Grefenstette
This work presents a differentiable approach to inductive logic programming, bridging the gap between symbolic and neural methods
**"Neural Theorem Provers"**
The paper introduces Neural Theorem Provers, which combine neural networks with logical reasoning
**"Learning to Reason: End-to-End Module Networks for Visual Question Answering"** - Ronghang Hu
This paper presents a modular approach to reasoning in the context of visual question answering
**"Reasoning with Neural Tensor Networks for Knowledge Base Completion"** - Bishan Yang, Wen-tau Yih, Xiaodong He, Jianfeng Gao, and Li Deng
The authors propose Neural Tensor Networks for reasoning over knowledge bases

author.literal: **"Attention Is All You Need"** - Ashish Vaswani, Noam Shazeer, Niki Parmar, Jakob Uszkoreit, Llion Jones, Aidan N. Gomez, Łukasz Kaiser, and Illia Polosukhin

title: This influential paper introduces the Transformer model, which has been applied to various reasoning tasks

author.literal: **"Compositional Semantic Parsing with Perceptron Training"** - Percy Liang, Michael I. Jordan, and Dan Klein

title: The paper discusses compositional semantic parsing, which is crucial for understanding and reasoning with natural language
**"Learning to Explain: Datasets and Models for Identifying Valid Reasoning Chains in Multihop Question-Answering"**
This work focuses on multihop question-answering, which requires reasoning across multiple pieces of information

author.literal: **"Neural-Symbolic Cognitive Reasoning"** - Artur S. d'Avila Garcez, Luis C. Lamb, and Dov M. Gabbay

title: A comprehensive overview of neural-symbolic systems and their applications to cognitive reasoning
**"Probabilistic Soft Logic for Relational Machine Learning"**
This paper introduces Probabilistic Soft Logic (PSL), a framework for reasoning with uncertain and relational data
**"Learning to Reason with Neural Networks and Logic Rules"**
The authors propose a method for integrating neural networks with logical rules for reasoning tasks
**"Explainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI): Concepts, Taxonomies, Opportunities and Challenges toward Responsible AI"**
This paper provides an overview of explainable AI, which is essential for understanding and reasoning about AI decisions
These articles should provide a solid foundation for understanding the various approaches and advancements in machine reasoning up to
